Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Wady \Wad"y\, n.; pl. {Wadies}. [Ar. w[=a]d[=i] a valley, a channel of a river, a river.] A ravine through which a brook flows; the channel of a water course, which is dry except in the rainy season. [1913 Webster]
